displayName.text: A Matter of Health NYC, Inc

authorAttributions.displayName: A Matter of Health NYC, Inc
A Matter of Health NYC, Inc
A Matter of Health NYC, Inc
A Matter of Health NYC, Inc

adrFormatAddress: 1347 1st Ave., New York, NY 10021, USA

originalText.text:
am usually at a Matter of Health every two weeks to stock up on their tuna salad  which I use to make sandwiches. I used to get my stock in a fish store walking distance from the apartment. However, they charge twice as much for the tuna and it's not even wild caught (they show the regular tuna cans in their counter). Luckily, found something much better in the Upper East Side.
A Matter of Health is probably the most fully stocked store of anything organic you will need. Usually, am here for the tuna though will also get 72% dark chocolate, bread, chips (so many kinds), coconut juice, fruits ( bananas, blueberries, grapes, kiwis, etc), wagyu hotdogs, buns, ice cream, shampoo and the list goes on. Prices are reasonable for organic stuff compared to other places. Place is usually busy after office hours and even early on the weekends (everyone seems to have the same idea but all end up coming at the same time)
The juices are pretty good and it depends on what you need the juice for. Lot of other sandwich spread choices aside from tuna as well. The store has practically everything one may need (perishable or non perishable).
If you decide to come here more than once, you should sign up for their promo to accumulate purchase points. This allows you to get credits to your purchase usually at the end of the year.
There is also a guy making fresh sushi. Right beside this area is where they serve hot soup (maybe 4 types) perfect for for a cool day.
I highly recommend visiting this store if ever you are in the Upper East Side. As I mentioned, it has almost everything one needs that is organic. Check it out.

originalText.text:
STORE -GREAT
HUMMUS NOT SO MUCH ANYMORE

ABRAHAMS HUMMUS PRODUCTS chooses to lower quality and stay the price-
I‚Äôve been buying ABRAHAMS babagganoush and hummus from this place for 5 years because it is the best I‚Äôve ever had at the cheapest price.
This past week I bought the Babba-G (can‚Äôt spell it) it was so WATTERY you could have used a straw. I gave them the benefit of a doubt and considered it a bad batch.
Today I bought hummus instead. Same thing. My review has nothing to do with MATTER OF HEALTH. It‚Äôs a fantastic store with even more fantastic people working there.üëèüëèüëè

originalText.text: The produce is fresh, and there is a ton of organic packaged health foods as well as dairy/non dairy. I can usually get everything I want there, including an entire section of vitamins and elixirs and natural body care products.

text.text: The produce is fresh, and there is a ton of organic packaged health foods as well as dairy/non dairy. I can usually get everything I want there, including an entire section of vitamins and elixirs and natural body care products.

originalText.text: Great store, but most of the employees there are very unpleasant. If you‚Äôre there even one minute past closing, they won‚Äôt allow you in or will kick you out. Never seen such strictness with a grocery store before. There should be better better training for the cashiers and employees in customer relations, or nicer people hired.

originalText.text: A Matter of Principle. I‚Äôve had two bad experiences here recently (refused to honor my loyalty reward, continuing to post a sale price on an item and then refusing to honor the posted sale price at checkout) that make me wary of shopping here any more. Two people (my son and a neighbor) have told me that they stopped shopping there because they found that they had been billed incorrect prices or excessive number of items. Beware. Check your bill before you pay. Or go somewhere else.
